AD_AccessCultistPrayer.synopsis: The cultest standing by the door to the roof of Moonrise recites prayers to herself in tones of quiet reverence. 2 of her ADs echo the prayers of Myrkulite cultist we meet below.

Guard02.synopsis: An Absolute guard on the upper floor.

TrespassWarning.synopsis: A guard questions intruding players on the upper floor of Moonrise Tower
TrespassWarning.how_to_trigger: X -154; Y 39; Z 183. Triggers automatically on approach.

Guard00.synopsis: An Absolute guard on the upper floor. She's bored and eager to fight in the name of his new god - or fight for any reason, really.

Guard01.synopsis: An Absolute guard on the upper floor. An officer in the army, reverent and deferential to General Thorm.

AD_ImpatientGuards.synopsis: Idle banter between two guards of rhe Absolute. One is young and eager for battle, the other is more seasoned and relaxed - but reveals himself to be a fanatic true believer

AD_AccessCultistPrayer_0.speaker: Radija
AD_AccessCultistPrayer_0.text: Many hearts, one soul. In Your name, Absolute.

AD_AccessCultistPrayer_1.speaker: Radija
AD_AccessCultistPrayer_1.text: Their cities shall be as dust beneath Your feet.

AD_AccessCultistPrayer_2.speaker: Radija
AD_AccessCultistPrayer_2.text: Our old lives are shed. Our old dreams are dead. We are of One Mind, in Your Design.

AD_AccessCultistPrayer_3.speaker: Radija
AD_AccessCultistPrayer_3.text: Bring dusk. Bring night. Bring Your Design.

Guard02_0.speaker: Zealot Klen
Guard02_0.text: Congratulations, True Soul. You'll surely be granted an audience - with Her.
Guard02_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: barely contained excitement - the 'Her' is a reference to their god, the Absolute

Guard02_1.speaker: Zealot Klen
Guard02_1.text: I hear you had a part in capturing the cleric. The General rewards those who're worthy, count on it.
Guard02_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped the cult kidnap Isobel and bring her to Moonrise.NodeContext: Impressed by us

Guard02_2.speaker: Zealot Klen
Guard02_2.text: They flew the cleric directly to the chapel above. No hiding from the Absolute's reach, eh?
Guard02_2.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped the cult kidnap Isobel and bring her to Moonrise.

Guard02_3.speaker: Zealot Klen
Guard02_3.text: We're finally marching - and it's because of you.
Guard02_3.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: barely contained excitement

Guard02_4.speaker: Zealot Klen
Guard02_4.text: If you've business up here, Disciple Z'rell will send for you.
Guard02_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Ketheric is still in private council dealing with some cultists who failed him. Default state on player's first arrival to tower.

Guard02_5.speaker: Zealot Klen
Guard02_5.text: Respectfully, True Soul - the General's in council downstairs. This floor is for him and Z'rell alone.
Guard02_5.context: InternalNodeContext: Ketheric is still in private council dealing with some cultists who failed him. Default state on player's first arrival to tower.

Guard02_6.speaker: Zealot Klen
Guard02_6.text: The General's retired to his chapel on the roof. If you're lucky, he might invite you to pray with him.

Guard02_7.speaker: Zealot Klen
Guard02_7.text: Whatever plans the General is making, we'll be ready.
Guard02_7.context: NodeContext: Speaking quietly, respectful. Wary of Ketheric's 'guests'

TrespassWarning_30.speaker: Zealot Klen
TrespassWarning_30.text: Halt. I know neither your stride nor your bearing.

TrespassWarning_27.speaker: Fist Marcus
TrespassWarning_27.text: Stand down, on the General's orders. This one may seek the audience of their choosing.

TrespassWarning_9.speaker: Zealot Klen
TrespassWarning_9.text: Very well - if the General wishes.

TrespassWarning_38.speaker: Zealot Klen
TrespassWarning_38.text: Disciples may enter. All others are to be culled, by the General's decree.

TrespassWarning_3.speaker: Narrator
TrespassWarning_3.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

TrespassWarning_29.speaker: Narrator
TrespassWarning_29.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*
TrespassWarning_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Symbol on NPC glowsInternalNodeContext: Delete if you are talking to a companion.

TrespassWarning_32.speaker: Player
TrespassWarning_32.text: Disciple Z'rell sent me with urgent news for the General.

TrespassWarning_0.speaker: Zealot Klen
TrespassWarning_0.text: Z'rell? Very well - do as you will. And know that I'm watching.

TrespassWarning_6.speaker: Player
TrespassWarning_6.text: I work for the General. Perhaps he should hear of your insolence.

TrespassWarning_26.speaker: Zealot Klen
TrespassWarning_26.text: I - no need. Travel the Towers as you see fit.

TrespassWarning_4.speaker: Zealot Klen
TrespassWarning_4.text: I know my orders. For the Absolute.

TrespassWarning_25.speaker: Player
TrespassWarning_25.text: Commune with your parasite, plant a thought: 'This one is a disciple.'

TrespassWarning_2.speaker: Zealot Klen
TrespassWarning_2.text: Pardon - you are a Disciple, indeed. The Towers are yours to explore.

TrespassWarning_34.speaker: Narrator
TrespassWarning_34.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

TrespassWarning_8.speaker: Narrator
TrespassWarning_8.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

TrespassWarning_5.speaker: Narrator
TrespassWarning_5.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

TrespassWarning_33.speaker: Narrator
TrespassWarning_33.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

TrespassWarning_37.speaker: Narrator
TrespassWarning_37.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

TrespassWarning_14.speaker: Narrator
TrespassWarning_14.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

TrespassWarning_18.speaker: Narrator
TrespassWarning_18.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

TrespassWarning_11.speaker: Zealot Klen
TrespassWarning_11.text: What madness is this? A traitor to the Absolute.

TrespassWarning_10.speaker: Player
TrespassWarning_10.text: Commune with your parasite, plant a thought: 'This one is a disciple.'

TrespassWarning_13.speaker: Player
TrespassWarning_13.text: Draw on the power within to enforce your will.

TrespassWarning_36.speaker: Narrator
TrespassWarning_36.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. It needs to rest.*

TrespassWarning_21.speaker: Player
TrespassWarning_21.text: Draw on the power within to enforce your will.

TrespassWarning_31.speaker: Narrator
TrespassWarning_31.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

Guard00_0.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00_0.text: Now the General's advisor is back, we can get moving. Praise Her bloody name.
Guard00_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.NodeContext: Satisfied

Guard00_1.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00_1.text: Weapons ready, True Soul. We're bound for Baldur's Gate!
Guard00_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Enthusiastic, hyped up

Guard00_4.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00_4.text: Hey, True Soul - what's the word?

Guard00_9.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00_9.text: Army's gathered outside. The General giving us marching orders?

Guard00_12.speaker: Player
Guard00_12.text: Keep it to yourself - but the General's advisor is missing.

Guard00_3.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00_3.text: The necromancer? The General won't leave one of his own behind.

Guard00_17.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00_17.text: He might be the Absolute's Chosen now, but he's still a soldier at heart.

Guard00_2.speaker: Player
Guard00_2.text: Why, soldier? Do you have somewhere else to be?

Guard00_10.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00_10.text: Just keen to get back to the Gate, is all. I was born there.

Guard00_8.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00_8.text: I want to be the first to put it to the torch.

Guard00_19.speaker: Player
Guard00_19.text: The Absolute's plan will unfold in good time. Have faith.

Guard00_7.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00_7.text: I have got faith, True Soul. 'Course I do.

Guard00_15.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00_15.text: Just got sores from all the sitting around, too.

Guard00_16.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00_16.text: ...Right you are, True Soul. Not questioning - just ready to serve, is all.
Guard00_16.context: NodeContext: Intimidated - he got a little too familiar with us (an officer of higher rank) and we simply stared him down in silenc.e

Guard00_5.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00_5.text: Hope we get moving soon. Got an army of beasts out there - don't want them getting bored.
Guard00_5.context: NodeContext: Referencing the army of beasts and their delay in marching

Guard00_6.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00_6.text: The General won't be long bringing the Selûnite to our side. The old gods are done.
Guard00_6.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped the cult kidnap Isobel and bring her to Moonrise.NodeContext: Assured

Guard00_13.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00_13.text: Seen our special guest? The General had her brought to the roof straight away - big plans, I'd say.
Guard00_13.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped the cult kidnap Isobel and bring her to Moonrise.NodeContext: A little jeering - they've taken a rival prisoner and now his General is dealing with her

Guard00_14.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00_14.text: Baldur's Gate has seen its share of madness - but it's not ready for what's coming.
Guard00_14.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Relishing the fight to come - he grew up in BG and hates it

Guard00_18.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00_18.text: Watch yourself around some of the guards. The ones the necromancers brought back are a little... odd.
Guard00_18.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.NodeContext: Warning - he's a little wary of these undead himself

Guard01_0.speaker: Zealot Bennel
Guard01_0.text: We are blessed, True Soul - to stand so close to General Thorm.

Guard01_2.speaker: Zealot Bennel
Guard01_2.text: Seen the view out west from the terrace? All those beasts camped under one banner.

Guard01_1.speaker: Zealot Bennel
Guard01_1.text: That's the Absolute's power. The General's power.

AD_ImpatientGuards_0.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_ImpatientGuards_0.text: You were Flaming Fist before this, weren't you lass?
AD_ImpatientGuards_0.context: NodeContext: Idle chatter, looking at his cards

AD_ImpatientGuards_4.speaker: Acolyte Daine
AD_ImpatientGuards_4.text: Save your 'lasses' for when you're courting. But aye - how d'you know?
AD_ImpatientGuards_4.context: NodeContext: Annoyed at being talked down to, but curious

AD_ImpatientGuards_7.speaker: Acolyte Daine
AD_ImpatientGuards_7.text: Ugh. There's blood on these cards.
AD_ImpatientGuards_7.context: NodeContext: After noticing some gore on her cards

AD_ImpatientGuards_5.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_ImpatientGuards_5.text: Aye. My brother's. Had to deal with him after he struck a True Soul - claimed she was some kind of monster.
AD_ImpatientGuards_5.context: NodeContext: Mild, barely looking up from his hand

AD_ImpatientGuards_9.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_ImpatientGuards_9.text: Had to toss him over that terrace there.
AD_ImpatientGuards_9.context: NodeContext: Only the vaguest regret - as if murdering his own brother was an unfortunate duty

AD_ImpatientGuards_3.speaker: Acolyte Daine
AD_ImpatientGuards_3.context: NodeContext: Mute shock at what she's just heard

AD_ImpatientGuards_1.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_ImpatientGuards_1.text: God. We belong to just the one now, remember.
AD_ImpatientGuards_1.context: NodeContext: First edge in his voice. Firmly clarifying that he won't brook any blasphemy against his god

AD_ImpatientGuards_10.speaker: Acolyte Daine
AD_ImpatientGuards_10.text: I'm sick as shit of looking at your mug. The sooner we march, the better.

AD_ImpatientGuards_8.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_ImpatientGuards_8.text: The General's just wrapping up a few loose ends. Besides - city's going nowhere.
AD_ImpatientGuards_8.context: NodeContext: Playing cards, mild - heard his comrade's complaints before

AD_ImpatientGuards_6.speaker: Acolyte Daine
AD_ImpatientGuards_6.context: NodeContext: Relish - looking forward to attacking the city
